alert.note: Alert for Deltana and Tanana Flats; Middle Tanana Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 01 at 5:52AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM AKDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...The Salcha River * WHEN...Until 400 PM AKDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Erosion of the river bank will occur. Trees and other debris will come down the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 536 AM AKDT, Heavy rain that fell over the Salcha River Monday through Wednesday is causing high water and minor flooding on the Upper Salcha River. A resident on the Salcha River 30 miles upstream of the Richardson Highway Bridge reported minor flooding at 7pm Wednesday with the water still rising. It is expected that the Salcha River is now cresting upstream of River mile 30, with the high water moving downstream and cresting at the Richardson Highway Bridge late this morning or early this afternoon. - Gravel bars will be under water. Logs and debris will float down the river. - For Salcha River near Salchaket: At 5:00am the stage was 12.3 feet. Flood Stage is 14.0 feet. Forecast: A crest around 14.0 feet is expected around 10:00am Thursday. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood People along the Salcha River should prepare for minor flooding.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.

area.areaDesc: Deltana and Tanana Flats; Middle Tanana Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country
